indicators.justification:
The Hellenic Republic has set in place a series of datasets available to the public, including the data of the data.gov.gr platform, and the data provided by the Ministry of Energy and Environment, through the European Emissions Trading System, which is displaying data offered by Greek authorities.

Sources:

(1) Ministry of Energy and Environment, Statistical records

(2) EU Emissions Trading System (EU ETS), main platform

(3) Monitoring, reporting and verification of EU ETS emissions

(4) Trends in the Emissions Trading System in the European Union and Greece, The Green Tank, 2021

(5) European EU Emissions Trading System (ETS) data viewer

(6) Hellenic Republic, Ministry of Energy and Environment, Emissions Trading System (SEDE)

indicators.justification:
Greece is part of the NATURA 2000 network, which has set strict policies on the protection of the environment, strict limitations on human activities in the areas declared as protected, as well as in the protection of the wildlife and especially the protected species. However, there is no central, single-point of reference, that provides relevant data on the status of the endagered species, in an open, structured and detailed way that utilizes modern technologies through machine readable formats, in a single dataset.

Sources:

(1) The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species - Greece ( Iucnredlist.org )

(2) Konstantina Spiliopoulou, Panayiotis G. Dimitrakopoulos, Thomas M. Brooks, Gabriela Kelaidi, Kaloust Paragamian, Vassiliki Kati, Anthi Oikonomou, Dimitris Vavylis, Panayiotis Trigas, Petros Lymberakis8, William Darwall, Maria Th. Stoumboudi, Kostas A. Triantis, 2021, The Natura 2000 network and the ranges of threatened
species in Greece, Biodiversity and Conservation

(3) European Environment Agency, Natura 2000 Network Viewer

(4) Platform of the Greek Government on the areas of protected wildspecies.

(5) Digital Repository of the Hellenic Center for Habitats ρο Wetlands (EKBY)

(6) Anastasios Legakis, Panagiota Marangou 2009 "The Red Book of endangered animals of Greece" - Hellenic Zoological Society "(The red book of Greece's endagere species".

evidence.title: International Union for Conservation of Nature’s Red List of Threatened Species - Coverage of Greece
The Natura 2000 network and the ranges of threatened species in Greece
Natura 2000 map viewer - Indicative case for the monitoring of endagered species in protected areas.
Platform of the Greek Government on the areas of protected wildlife
Central repository tracking and monitoring the biodiversity of Greece

indicators.justification:
Until now, Greece did not have a specific, clear and operating legal framework regarding climate vulnerability information, so there are no detailed, structured and machine readable open data on this topic. However, it is worth mentioning that recently (September 2021) the Greek Government decided and established a new Ministry of Climate Crisis and Civil Protection, aiming at tackling the effects of the climate change and creating strategic plans for the prevention of major natural disasters. Given that, major developments on the issue of relevant open data shall be expected in the upcoming years.

(1) Hellenic Republic, Presidential Decree, Establishment of the Ministry of Climate Crisis and Civil Protection (PD 70/2021)

(2) Presidential Decree 70/2021 - Government Gazette 161 / Α / 9-9-2021

evidence.title: Establishment of the Ministry of Climate Crisis and Civil Protection (PD 70/2021)
Presidential Decree 70/2021 - Government Gazette 161 / Α / 9-9-2021

indicators.justification:
Hellenic Republic is following closely and imposing the European Directives on Beneficial Ownership, through a series of legislation acts aiming at creating the grounds for the mapping of beneficial owners through the official platform of GSIS.

indicators.justification:
Further actions are being undertaken in order to enhance the accessibility of company information available as structured open data, yet there are still barries to the extent of the openness of those data, with the main limitation being the need to contact the relevant authority and request access for research purposes, upon confirmation and acceptance of the inquiry if the requested dataset is available as a whole.

(2) Hellenic Data Protection Authority

(3) Hellenic Republic, Athens Chamber of Industry and Commerce, Business directory

(4) Hellenic Statistics Authority - Record of businesses (up to 2018)

The Hellenic Statistical Authority and the the government platform data.gov.gr are the two public addresses displaying data on the birth and mortality rates.

indicators.justification:
The National Public Health Organization and the Civil Protection Greece are monitoring the capacity of the Health system in real-time, especially in the context of COVID-19. 
Relevant data could be available for research purposes by contacting the Ministry of Health, but are not available as open data in real time, especially, as the current survey requires, at the level of "level of individual facilities and include details such as the number, type, and availability of beds, tests, vaccines, and devices".
The Hellenic Statistical Authority and the the government platform data.gov.gr are the two public addresses displaying data on the birth and mortality rates.
Especially the Hellenic Statistical Authority publishes relevant data through tactical reports (in pdf formats) while further machine-readable data could be accessed by contacting the Authority for research purposes, as they are not available as an open, license-free and directly web-accessed dataset.

(1) Gov.gr Platform, Intensive Unit Care Management System
(2) National Organization for the Provision of Health Services (EOPYY)

evidence.title: Availability of the Intensive Care Units

indicators.justification:
The Government of the Hellenic Republic has made a direct effort, since the start of the vaccination program, to make relevant data openly available and accessible. In this context, the central platform https://emvolio.gov.gr/vaccinationtracker was utilized, being the sole and official source for the accurate monitoring of the numbers of vaccinated citizens. There are four main categories: 1. Total vaccinations, 2. One dose vaccinations, 3. Completed vaccinations, 4. Third-dose vaccinations. Moreover, there are specific statistics on the vaccination coverage of each region of the country, while the official data of the platform are updated daily at 21:00.
Beyond that platform, there is another web address offering the data in machine readable format, as published by the Hellenic Government.

Sources:
(1) National Vaccination Campaign, Statistical data on vaccinations (link: https://emvolio.gov.gr/vaccinationtracker ).

(2) Hellenic Republic, Greek Government, Vaccination statistics for COVID-19, GOV.GR Health Section

evidence.title: Covid-19 Vaccination Tracker
Vaccination Statistics - Token needed for access

indicators.justification:
Greece has undertaken a major, decades-long initiative, in order to track and monitor and clear and effective way for gathering, accessing and analysing data regarding land tenure. Yet, the relevant initiative, called in Greek "Ktimatologio", has not been officially or practically completed, therefore such data are missing, with the expectance to be available in the upcoming years.

(1) Government Gazzette, Law 2664/1998
(2) Government Gazzette, Law 4164/2013
(3) Government Gazzette, Law 4821/2021 - 134 / Α / 31-7-2021

indicators.justification:
Even though the budget of the Government (and the draft) are published yearly in detail, still the data, despite the fact that could be extracted by the pdf and excel files, are not provided according to the international standards of the open and structured way that utilizes modern technologies through machine readable formats, in a single dataset.

(1) Ministry of Finance, Hellenic Republic, Performance Budgeting Section

(2) Hellenic Republic, Ministry of Finance, Document for the preparation of the General Government Budget for the financial year 2022

evidence.title: Performance budgeting - pilot program
Ministry of Finance - Downloadable excel files on the budget of the General Government

responses.response_text: Data is available from government, or because of government actions.
responses.subquestion_text: Is this data available online in any form?
There is structured data available on the executive budget proposal in gross terms, including spending on annual and multi-annual investment projects.
There is structured data available on amended budgets (when applicable) or amendments of the enacted budget.
There is structured data available on the approved or enacted budget in gross terms, including spending on annual and multi-annual investment projects.
There is structured data about government budget execution or spending, in gross terms and on an accrual basis, including spending in annual and multi-annual investment projects.
There is structured data about the government's extrabudgetary funds spending, in gross terms and on an accrual basis.
There is structured data about the government's social security spending, in gross terms and on an accrual basis.
There is structured data about public corporations' spending, in gross terms and on an accrual basis.
Budget entries have administrative classifications to an internationally agreed standard.
Budget entries have economic classifications to an internationally agreed standard.
Budget entries have functional classifications to an internationally agreed standard.
Budget entries have program classifications according to an internationally agreed standard.
Information about individual financial transactions or expenditures is available at the most disaggregated level of the economic classification level.
Data is disaggregated by cross-cutting programs, or issues such as SDGs, climate action, gender budgeting, etc,
The data contains common identifiers to connect budget and budget performance data.
The data contains identifiers that can be used to connect budget data with data on major projects (e.g., infrastructure construction) and procurement processes.
Dataset is available free of charge.
Data is openly licensed.
Data is available in all the country’s official or national languages. If the country has no official or national languages, data is available in the major languages of the country.
There are accessible and open official tools available to help users explore data.
Data is timely and updated.
Historical data is available that allows users to track change over time.
Data is provided in machine-readable format(s)
The machine-readable dataset is available as a whole

indicators.justification:
The relevant datasets cannot be located and identified in a single source, portal or platform, and are not structured in a machine readable format, yet there could be some independent data that are open, such as Decision No. 19724 on the "Distribution of regular state funding and government funding for researchers and training purposes to the beneficiaries political parties and coalitions of political parties - 2020". Still, the accessibility and availability of political finance information, as open data, has a very wide room for growth, regarding the areas covered and the details provided, as well as the timeframes available and the accessibility of those datasets by the public.


Sources:

(1) Technical report - Improving the legal framework and practices for integrity in the financing of political parties & candidates

(2) OECD Educational manual for regulating the financing of political parties & candidates

(3) LAW 4304 / Government Gazette A 234 / 23.10.2014 Audit of economic and political parties and elected representatives of Parliament and the European Parliament and other provisions.
http://www.dsanet.gr/Epikairothta/Nomothesia/n%204304.htm

(4) Government Gazzette Issue 1024, Decision 19724, "Distribution of regular state funding
and government funding for researchers and training purposes to the beneficiaries
political parties and coalitions of political parties
2020".

evidence.title: OECD - Integrity in the financing of political parties and candidates in Greece
OECD: Technical report - Improving the legal framework and practices for integrity in the financing of political parties & candidates
OECD Educational manual for regulating the financing of political parties & candidates

indicators.justification:
Since 2010, Greece has developed the "Diavgeia" platform, aiming at enhancing transparency with the mandatory posting of laws and acts of government, administrative and self-governing bodies on the internet. The platform contains a series of datasets as detailed structured data, that can be accessed through the above-mentioned links. According to the statistics offered by the platform, there are more than 46,6 million acts (actions) published, with 5090 entities uploading relevant data and documents and 118261 registered users. Yet, there is signigicant room for growth in the datasets available in machine readable structured formats, which are currentlylimited.

(1) Website of the Diavgeia Platform (statistics) ( https://diavgeia.gov.gr/ ).

(2) Law NO. 3861 Government Gazette AD112 / 13.7.2010

indicators.justification:
The Digital Strategy of 2020 - 2025 has a clear projection on the data reuse, which is one of the highlighted sections, regarding the wider data management.
Especially in the data reuse, there are clear references on the document ( http://www.opengov.gr/digitalandbrief/wp-content/uploads/downloads/2020/12/digitalstrategy.pdf ), namely at pages:
Page 8, point 6: Incentive programs for the reuse of the open data for the development of applications of added value.
Page 46: Section 6.5 Interoperability Center
"A basic principle when designing new online services is
interoperability-by-design, which
concerns both the technical and the semantic and organizational level.
At the same time, the utilization of reusable structural elements (reusable components) creates economies of scale and facilitates viability of implementations".
According to the official document, the Digital Strategy explores the wider estimated impact of the data re-use and its benefits for the greater public good, including the effectiveness of the public authorities and agencies as well as the economic benefits through the better management of the available resources and planning.
Moreover, beyond the document of the Strategy, another law (4622/2019), aims at creating the conditions, in the public sector, which will allow the State to perform in a more effective way in the whole spectrum of its operations, including the data re-use. The change in this policy area will be seen and experienced after the completion of the relevant projects mentioned in the document of the Digital Transformation Strategy 2020-2025, as there is no such operational capability currently in full effect.

(1) Government Gazzette 133/A//7-8-2019, Law 4622/2019, Law 4622/2019, "Executive State: organisation, operation and transparency of the Government, government bodies and central public administration", 2019

evidence.title: Digital Strategy 2020 - 2025

indicators.justification:
Despite the absence of a similar major initiative in the past, which was also proven by a series of international surveys and publications, where Greece's position was often located beyond the median, the Government of Greece has recently established and is actively pursuing an holistic approach towards a major initiative, aiming at reinventing the role of the digital technologies in both the internal utilities for the state agencies and authorities, as well as in the relationships among the state and the citizens. Still, most of the projects have a medium to long term horizon of completion and full implementation, so the results of this initiative shall be expected in the upcoming years, with a major milestone the year 2025, as set in the official document of the Digital Strategy.

(1) Strategy for the Digital Transformation 2020 (Timeframe 2020 - 2025).

indicators.justification:
Athough city, regional and local governments hold a prominent and essential role in the management of the public affairs, often through exclusive juristinction, there is currently no wide practise that would support their engagement in the effectiveness of data management. As mentioned in other sections of the current research survey, the Digital Strategy 2020-2025 aims at advancing the accessibility and usability of an increased number of data for those actors, through better data-management and data-sharing systems.

indicators.justification:
Currently, no such legal framework has been explicitly established, aiming at the data interoperability across different political integrity datasets or other datasets associated with relevant information flows. 
The Digital Strategy 2020-2025 has made projections on raising this interoperability, yet a dedicated project that is defined as such, could not be identified. However, the idea of interoperability that would enhance, even indirectly, political integrity, has been included in the new data-sharing framework, although not strictly interrelated.

Sources on the intention of developing interoperability:
(1) Ministry of Digital Governance, Strategy for the Digital Transformation 2020 – 2025, Hellenic Republic

(2) Greek Government Gazette, 2020, Number 184 Issue 1st, 2020

indicators.justification:
Through its officialy declared and established Digital Strategy 2020 - 2025, Greece aims at creating a new, clear and permanent framework for data sharing, that will allow all key stakeholders, including national authorities, state agencies and relevant actors to access certain open data in a highly usable way. This pillar of the strategy aims at enhancing the interoperability of the all the state agencies, which is currently underdeveloped. The existing reality is problematic, especially during the past decades, but the current Government has taken action towards filling the existing gaps in the data sharing area.

(1) Strategy for the Digital Transformation 2020 (Timeframe 2020 - 2025).

indicators.justification:
Greece has complied with the European legislation and direction on the data protection policies, throuth the well known GDPR Law, through tha national Law Number 4624/2019
Government Gazette Issue 137/Α/29-8-2019
(NOMOΣ ΥΠ' ΑΡΙΘΜ. 4624/2019
ΦΕΚ 137/Α/29-8-2019).
The Law number 4624/2019 came in full effect in 2019 and has since been embodied in most of the user's interaction with public authorities and private actors. In practice, the spirit of this law brings in effect the European General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). According to the European Regulation, the Law is automatically enacted starting from 25/5/2018, even without the condition of state legislation.

indicators.justification:
The official language of Greece is a rather complex issue, despite the existence of the Greek language as the official and primary language of the Hellenic Republic. This is a result of the removal of article 107 from the Constitution, back in 1975, which included the projection of the Greek language as the official language of the State, prohibiting any modification or deterioration of the language. This action was explained, during the Revision of the Constitution (1975), that aimed at establishing a modern form of the greek language ("dimotiki" -demotic versus the older "kathareuoysa" - purist Greek), especially in the education system.
However, Greek is the de facto dominant language in Greece. It is a common practice for data collection and publication processes to be available in the country's official or national languages, which is the Greek language. Before 1975 the Constitution had a 

Sources

(1) Hellenic Republic, Constitution of the Hellenic Republic, 1975

(2) Evangelos, Petrounias. [2001] 2013. Modern Greek grammar and comparative ("contrasting") analysis (Volume 1, Part 1: Theory). Thessaloniki: Ziti (reprint with corrections)

Evangelos, Petrounias. 2001

indicators.justification:
Greece has established, after the 2019 elections, the "Strategy of Digital Transformation - Βίβλος Ψηφιακού Μετασχηματισμού" (link: http://www.opengov.gr/digitalandbrief/wp-content/uploads/downloads/2020/12/digitalstrategy.pdf ) which projects a series of critical reforms, across various sectors of public policy, governmental agencies, local governments and municipalities. 
This document, at section 6.6 refers clearly to the open data definitions and approaches, the need for their further significant development and usability for machine extraction and the need for full alignment with the European legislation on open data.
Previously, a series of national legislation texts attempted to align Greece with the multiple directives of the EU. Given the opportunity of the EU Next Gen Resiliency Fund and the favorable circumstance of the European Union initiatives on the further development of the use of open data, Greece has composed and set in place a wide, multilevel and unified strategy, not only for its alignment with the European Directives, but also for the creation of a one-stop platform for open data (https://data.gov.gr/), that includes both the list of available datasets, which is progressively enhanced, and the active national and European legislation on open data.
Given the current situation throughout the covid pandemic and the EU Next Gen Resiliency Fund, the strategy holds an integral and prominent role in the national planning of Hellenic Republic.


The list of the supporting evidence indicates a wide variety of the existing legal frameworks, which are active in Greece in both Greek and European initiative and jurisdiction. 
The "REGULATION OF THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT AND OF THE COUNCIL on European data governance (Data Governance Act)
COM/2020/767 final" emerges as the common European practice, until its full operational capacity.

(1) Strategy for the Digital Transformation 2020 (Timeframe 2020 - 2025).
http://www.opengov.gr/digitalandbrief/wp-content/uploads/downloads/2020/12/digitalstrategy.pdf

(2) Greek Government Gazette, 2020, Number 184 Issue 1st, 2020, 
http://www.opengov.gr/digitalandbrief/wp-content/uploads/downloads/2020/12/fek-184-2020.pdf

(3) Law 4305/2014 - Government Gazette 237 / A / 31-10-2014 Article 2 General principles
(article 1 par. 3 of Directive 2013/37 / EU)

(4) European Commission 2020, Proposal for a REGULATION OF THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT AND OF THE COUNCIL on European data governance
(Data Governance Act)

(5) Hellenic Republic, Government Gazzette, Law 4305/2014: Open disposal and re-use of documents, information and data of the public sector, amendment of law 3448/2006 (A '57), adaptation of national legislation to the provisions of Directive 2013/37 / EU of the European Parliament.

responses.response_text: A framework exists and has the force of law.
responses.subquestion_text: What is the nature of the framework?
The framework establishes a common definition of open data.
The framework promotes open licensing without any restrictions beyond attribution and share-alike.
The framework requires to publish data in machine readable formats.
The rules/guidance requires the use of specific data standards.
The framework promotes training and capacity building among government officials.

responses.response_text: The relevant laws, policies and guidance assessed cover the majority of localities and government agencies.
responses.subquestion_text: How widely do these laws, regulations, policies or guidance apply?

indicators.justification:
Greece has an extensive and detailed background on collecting and publishing data on public finances, including government budgets, government spending, debt, and borrowing. Yet, most of those data are not published in a a tactical, open and structured way that utilizes modern technologies through machine readable formats, in a single dataset.

Sources:
(1) Ministry of Finance, Budget, Debt and Relevant Data
(2) Ministry of Finance, Legal framework
(3) National Coordinating Body - Audit and Accountability

Ministry of Finance - Legal framework
NATIONAL COORDINATING BODY AUDIT AND ACCOUNTABILITY

responses.subquestion_text: Are there laws, policies, or regulations requiring collection or publication of this information in any form?

responses.response_text: Requirements to publish this information as open data are set out in binding policy, regulations, or law.
responses.subquestion_text: Do relevant laws, policies, regulations, or guidance discuss the publication of open data?
Summary reports must be provided as structured data.
Expenditure information at the most disaggregated level of the economic classification must be provided as structured data.
The rules/guidance require executive budget proposal information to be provided as structured data.
The rules/guidance require the approved or enacted budget to be provided as structured data.
The rules/guidance require in-year reports as structured data.
The rules/guidance require year-end reports as structured data.
The rules/guidance empower an agency or official to ensure the accurate and timely collection and publication of required data.
The framework requires a verification process.
The rules/guidance require that data is regularly updated.
The rules/guidance support the collection of structured data.

responses.response_text: The laws, regulations, policies or guidance assessed, or equivalent rules/guidance, apply across the whole public sector including national, sub-national, and local government.

indicators.justification: There is no clear legal framework aimed exclusively at collecting and publishing data on lobbying activities, especially in a tactical, open and structured way that utilized modern technologies through machine readable formats.

indicators.justification:
The law of the Government LAW 4304 / 2014 refers to the framework of auditing economic and political parties and elected representatives of Parliament and the European Parliament. According to the section (da) of the Law Law 4304/2014 - Government Gazette 234 / A / 23-10-2014, political parties are audited focusing on "the period of six (6) months before the announcement of the regular general parliamentary elections or the elections for the election of the Greek representatives in the European Parliament".

Sources 

(1) LAW 4304 / Government Gazette A 234 / 23.10.2014
Audit of economic and political parties and elected representatives of Parliament and the European Parliament and other provisions.

(2) LAW NO. 3023/2002
Government Gazette 146 / Α / 25-6-2002

indicators.justification:
Greece is aiming at enhancing its position in the current thematic, through the Digital Strategy 2020 - 2025 and its committment to the Open Government Partnership through the country's Action Plan. Currently, there is no sole legal framework aimed exclusively at collecting and publishing data enerated through and about public consultation on rulemaking, especially in a tactical, open and structured way that utilizes modern technologies through machine readable formats.

(1) Open Government Partnership - Greece Action Plan 2019-2022 – Updated (English)

indicators.justification: There is no clear legally established framework on products or services that use open company data to support due diligence, given the limitations described regarding both the lack of such data and the lack of relevant open tools and machine-readable data and open visualization tools.

indicators.justification:
Despite the declared and clearly stated intention of the Hellenic Government to change the current reality, where the databases containg geospatial data are not interconnected, as described in the Digital Strategy of the Ministry of Digital Governance (page 175), the current situation provides minimum interconnection of those datasets and platforms, with a lack of both visual tools and machine-readable capabilities.

Sources:
(1) Digital Strategy 2020 - 2025, Ministry of Digital Governance

(2) Government Gazzette, Law 4821/2021 - 134 / Α / 31-7-2021
